EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



All employees of International Cushioning Company LLC are provided the following policy statement:



It is the policy of International Cushioning Company LLC to comply with all Environmental, Health and Safety regulations and requirements.  



Upon identifying a circumstance which could lead to a violation of a regulation or requirement established to protect human health, safety, and/or the environment, the person (or persons) identifying the circumstance shall take immediate corrective action, if such action is reasonably within their authority and ability to perform.  Should immediate correction not be performed, the person (or persons) identifying the circumstance shall immediately inform their supervisor, so that appropriate corrective actions can be taken.



Failure to comply with this policy may result in termination of employment.



Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled



International Cushioning Company LLC manufactures expandable polystyrene resin.  An isopentane / n-pentane mixture is used to manufacture the resin.



The maximum amount of isopentane / n-pentane mixture onsite is 40,700 pounds.



General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps



International Cushioning Company LLC has developed and implemented a Process Safety Management Program and Risk Management Plan.  International Cushioning Company LLC performs periodic Process Hazards Analyses and routine safety inspections.  The purpose of the program, plan, analyses and inspections are to ensure the safe operation and maintenance of the pentane tank and the associated processes.



Five Year Accident History



There have been no accidental releases of isopentane / n-pentane mixture since the facility began operations in 2005.



Emergency Response Program



International Cushioning Company LLC maintains an Emergency Action / Emergency Response Plan.  T

he primary purpose of this plan is to ensure employee safety in the event of an emergency.  In the event of an accidental release, International Cushioning Company LLC has and continues to work with the Catawba County Fire Marshall?s Office to ensure public safety.  A copy of the Emergency Action / Emergency Response Plan and Risk Management Plan have been provided to the Propst Crossroads Volunteer Fire Department and the Catawba County Fire Marshall?s Office.  The Catawba County Fire Marshall?s Office performs periodic inspections of the pentane tank to supplement International Cushioning Company LLC's routine inspections.  In the event of an accidental release, the Propst Crossroads Volunteer Fire Department will act as the primary emergency response agency.

    

Planned Changes to Improve Safety



International Cushioning Company LLC plans to implement the approved recommendations from its August 20, 2008, Process Hazard Analysis.  International Cushioning Company LLC also plans to perform or cooperatively participate in the following safety reviews:



* Self performed routine inspections of the pentane tank and systems,

* Self performed periodic Process Hazards Analyses,

* Self performed periodic Process Safety Management Program audits, 

* Self performed periodic Risk Management Plan reviews,

* Insurance carrier inspections,

* Catawba County Fire Marshall?s Office inspections,

* Occupational Health and Safety Administration Consultative Services inspections, and

* North Carolina, Division of Air Quality inspections.



In the event changes are identified through these inspections and/or safety reviews that would improve safety, International Cushioning Company LLC plans to implement such changes.
